bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Ernest Hutchinson For a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
State of Washington, County of King.
To the Honorable C.H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled court:

Comes now L.C. Smith, Sheriff of King County, Washington, the respondent herein, and respectfully shows to this honorable court that it is true that one Ernest Hutchinson, petitioner herein, is now and was at the time of the service of the writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled matter in the custod of this respondent, and that the detention of said petitioner by this respondent is lawful in this:

That said L.C. Smith, Sheriff of King County, Washington, acting in the public sevice and not otherwise, did arrest the petitioner herein, upon a warrant issued out of the Superiror Court of King County, State of Washington, wherein and whereby said petitioner was charged with selling trading stamps, a copy of which said information is attached to the petition herein and is herey referred to and made a part of this return.
Respondent herein, having shown to this honorable court that

said petitioner is so held by due and lawful process, nevertheless now produces before this honorable court the body of said petioner herein, at the time and place as in said writ directed, and hereto attaches and makes a part of this return said writ as upon him served.
Your respondent prays this honorable court that said writ be now denied, and that the petioner be held to await the determination of his trial in the superior court herinabove referred to.
State of Washington, County of King} ss.

L.C. Smith, being first duly sworn, upon oath deposes and says that he is the respondent named in the foregoing return; that he has read the same, knows the contents thereof, and the same is true as he verily believes.
Subscribed and sworn to before me, this 3 day of August, 1901. Kenneth Mackintosh Notary public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle in said state.
